thread.title: 15 Things Anyone With Endometriosis Needs You To Know
thread.title_full: 15 Things Anyone With Endometriosis Needs You To Know

author: Lara Parker, Charlotte Gomez
title: 15 Things Anyone With Endometriosis Needs You To Know
text:
View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Endometriosis is a condition where the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus actually grows outside of the uterus (typically on your ovaries, fallopian tubes, or pelvic organs). This can cause severe pain, inflammation, and even the formation of scar tissue. Pain from endometriosis can occur at any time of the month, and is not limited to menstrual cramps .
ID: 7974188 2. Painkillers usually don’t do the trick. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed ID: 7974191 3. And the pain doesn’t always manifest in the same way. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Hello, why does my leg hurt today?
ID: 10545962 4. Our endometriosis is probably not going away anytime soon… View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed There is currently no cure for endometriosis.
ID: 8423335 5. … So we don’t always know what to say when someone asks if we’re “feeling better yet.” View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Like, no? I’m not. Sorry.
ID: 10545987 6. Pregnancy isn’t a cure . View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed ID: 8423454 7. And sometimes neither is surgery . View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed ID: 8423457 8. There’s a good chance that we’ve tried every single “cure” available on the internet. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed So while we appreciate your concern, we don’t want to know about the weird pill your Facebook friend from high school messaged you about.
ID: 10545970 9. We never *choose* to miss out on social activities due to pain. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Being in pain literally every single day is certainly not a choice.
ID: 10545974 10. It’s not just physical pain, it’s emotional. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Dealing with physical pain day after day can take a serious toll.
ID: 8424186 11. It’s not uncommon. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed It’s estimated that at least five million women live with endometriosis in the US alone.
ID: 8637912 12. But it’s still common to be misdiagnosed for years. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Research suggests that there is an average of 7.5 years between a woman seeing a doctor and actually getting the endometriosis diagnosis.
ID: 8638067 13. It affects our lives in some way every. single. day. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed ID: 10545933 14. Telling us our illness “could be worse” is incredibly insensitive. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Absolutely, there are other problems and illnesses in the world. But that doesn’t change the fact that we are living in daily physical pain.
ID: 10545956 15. And just because you can’t see our illness doesn’t mean it isn’t there. View this image › 
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed ID: 10545946 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
